intro: Anthalogea polygama, commonly known as the scarlet pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Violaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and showy, bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its flowers open in the morning and close in the evening, a behavior known as nyctinasty. Anthalogea polygama is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant color and unique blooming pattern.
